function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased focus on occupant health in building design and operation due to recent pandemic.","Impact":"Unprepared buildings may lead to poor indoor air quality and transmission of contagious diseases, impacting occupant health.","Mitigation":"Implementing proper ventilation systems, air filtration, and sanitation protocols to ensure healthy indoor environments and reduce the spread of contagious diseases.","Technologies":"Advanced ventilation systems, air purifiers, UV sanitation technology.","People":"Building occupants, especially those in crowded or poorly ventilated spaces.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, construction professionals."},{"Description":"Data-related challenges for achieving design and operation of healthy buildings.","Impact":"Inadequate data may lead to ineffective decision-making in building design and operation, compromising occupant health and safety.","Mitigation":"Utilizing advanced data collection and analysis tools, implementing building performance monitoring systems, and improving data management practices.","Technologies":"IoT sensors, building management systems, data analytics software.","People":"Building owners, facility managers, data analysts, and building designers.","Owner":"Building owners, data analysts, building designers."},{"Description":"Impact of pandemic on building professionals' perspective regarding buildings' impact on occupant health.","Impact":"Lack of awareness or investment in healthy building practices may lead to continued vulnerabilities to contagious diseases in buildings.","Mitigation":"Educating building professionals, promoting industry standards for healthy building practices, and incentivizing the adoption of health-centric design and operation strategies.","Technologies":"Online education platforms, industry certification programs, building performance simulation software.","People":"Building professionals, architects, engineers, building managers.","Owner":"Industry organizations, government agencies, educational institutions."}]}
